0P000070MX.TO.long_name: Franklin Quotential Balanced Income Portfolio A
0P000070MX.TO.summary: A balance of current income and long-term capital appreciation by investing in a diversified mix of equity and income mutual funds, with a bias towards income.
0P000070MX.TO.manager_bio: Mr. Smith joined Franklin Templeton Investments Private Client Group in February 1996, where he is currently Chief Investment Officer and Portfolio Manager for the Quotential Program. Prior to joining the Private Client Group, Mr. Smith spent eight years with a major Canadian Life Insurer. Mr. Smith is a graduate of the University of New Brunswick (B.BA, 1986) and received his Chartered Financial Analyst designation in 1999.

0P000070W1.TO.long_name: Canada Life Fid NStar Bal Gens
0P000070W1.TO.summary: This segregated fund invests all of its assets in the Fidelity Canadian Asset Allocation Fund, a mutual fund managed by Fidelity Investments Canada Limited. Fidelity Canadian Asset Allocation Fund aims to achieve high total investment return. This fund uses an asset allocation approach. It invests primarily in a mix of Canadian equity securities, fixed-income securities and money market instruments.
0P000070W1.TO.manager_bio: Bob Swanson is a vice president and portfolio manager with Pyramis Global Advisors, a Fidelity Investments company. Prior to joining Fidelity in 1999, he worked as a portfolio manager at Bank of America in Chicago. Mr. Swanson received a B.S. from Northern Illinois University and an M.B.A. from Northwestern's Kellogg Graduate School of Business. He is a CFA charterholder and a member of the Chicago Quantitative Alliance, Boston Security Analysts Society, and the Institute of Chartered Financial Analysts.

0P000136LQ.TO.long_name: Fidelity NorthStar Bal Ccy Netrl Sr T8
0P000136LQ.TO.summary:
The Fund aims to achieve long-term capital growth. 
It seeks a similar return to its underlying fund, which is also managed by Fidelity, by investing substantially all of its assets in units of that fund. The underlying fund aims to achieve long-term capital growth by investing primarily in a mix of equity securities and fixed income securities from around the world. The underlying fund can invest in these securities either directly or indirectly through investments in other underlying funds. Currently, the underlying fund is Fidelity NorthStarÂ® Balanced Fund.
0P000136LQ.TO.manager_bio: Daniel Dupont is a portfolio manager for Pyramis Global Advisors, a Fidelity Investments company. He joined Fidelity in 2001 as a research analyst analyzing companies in the Canadian consumer product and food and drug retailing industries, then adding coverage of the Canadian gold industry and banks. Mr. Dupont received a Joint Honours in economics & finance from the McGill Commerce program in 2001.

0P00014ZC3.TO.manager_bio:
Judith Chan is Director, Portfolio Solutions - Canadian
Banking at 1832 Asset Management L.P. With more than 10 years in the investment industry, she currently manages all Scotia Portfolios which encompasses asset allocation, fund selection, fund due diligence, and the day-to-day management of all portfolios. Judith has a Bachelor of Economics from Simon Fraser University in Vancouver British Columbia, and has been a CFA Charterholder since 2006.

0P0001AL1E.TO.summary: Counsel Conservative Portfolio seeks to achieve a balance between income and capital growth with a moderate level of investment risk. The Fund invests in securities of a variety of Canadian, U.S. and international equity and fixed income mutual funds.
0P0001AL1E.TO.manager_bio: Mr. Scanlon is a Co-Head of Fixed Income, specializing in global credit and tax-exempt strategies. He is responsible for managing all facets of the corporate credit investment process and overseeing Putnam's taxexempt team. In addition, he is accountable for the research, trading, and creation of stand-alone corporate credit portfolios as well as a number of multi-sector strategies. Mr. Scanlon joined Putnam in 1999 and has been in the investment industry since 1986. Paul is a CFA charterholder.

0P0001E09O.TO.summary: The Fund intends to provide investors with a diversified portfolio solution that provides a steady flow of income and long-term capital stability by investing in Underlying Funds and/or directly in securities. Under normal market conditions, asset class exposures will be 60-80% fixed-income and 20-40% equity. The Portfolio Advisor may review and adjust these exposures without notice. In addition, the Fund may also invest in other asset classes, including Investors Real Property Fund. Currently, the Portfolio Advisor does not intend to maintain an investment in Investors Real Property Fund.
